alert.note: Alert for Broadwater; Cascade; Central and Southern Lewis and Clark; Meagher (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 15 at 12:28AM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Lewis and Clark, northern Broadwater, western Meagher and southern Cascade Counties through 130 AM MDT... At 1226 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 13 miles southeast of Wolf Creek to 19 miles northeast of Montana City to 9 miles east of East Helena to near Townsend. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Townsend, White Sulphur Springs, Fort Logan On The Smith River, Newlan Creek Reservoir, Winston, York, Eden, Silos, Fort Logan and Goose Bay. This includes the following highways... Highway 12 between mile markers 1 and 14, between mile markers 18 and 22, between mile markers 28 and 44, and between mile markers 59 and 81. Highway 89 between mile markers 6 and 57. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
